Award.AwardTitle: MRI: Acquisition of a Physical Properties Measurement System With 9 Tesla Magnetometer (Dynacool) for Research and Teaching at VCU
Award.AbstractNarration:
This Major Research Instrumentation award will help acquire a Physical Properties Measurement System (PPMS) with autorotation, supplementary electrical measurements and low and high temperature capabilities coupled with a Vibrating Sample Magnetometer (VSM) at Virginia Commonwealth University (VCU). Additionally, the cryogen-free PPMS/VSM would enable making robust low temperature measurements without requiring liquid helium to extremely sensitive magnetic measurements. The equipment will help enhance research and teaching efforts at VCU and nearby universities including those related to Smart Materials, Electron Theory of Solids, Solid State Physics and Experimental techniques and Foundations of Nanoscience. Improved facilities at VCU will impact high tech skills imparted to both regular and part time students which eventually will help industries located in northeast USA.

This major instrumentation will help support researchers at VCU who have developed research programs in which fundamental properties of magnetic materials are used in devising novel applications. These materials are being studied at different length scales for applications ranging from magnetostrictive sonar transducers, self-sensing magnetoelectric actuators, spintronic devices, non-volatile memory, magnetic nanoparticular catalysts, magnetic nanoparticles for biomedical applications such as magnetic hyperthermia for oncological treatment and nanoscale sensors. The fundamental scientific contributions include understanding anisotropic behavior of magnetic and magnetostrictive materials along different crystallographic orientations, magnetoelectric behavior of multifunctional magnetostrictive-piezoelectric composites at multiple length scales, experimental understanding of self-assembled ordered arrays of magnetic nanowires and quantum dots produced by selective chemical or physical electrodeposition on nm-sized pores of an alumina film and magnetic study of nano-manufactured nanoparticles of ferrites and gadolinium based materials. These activities require a Physical Properties Measurement System (PPMS) with supplementary Vibration Sample Magnetometer (VSM) capable of measuring magneto-electric, mangetocaloric and magneto-optic measurements at both low and high temperature and fields. Additionally, the use of a liquid helium-free PPMS would enable robust low temperature measurements. This will keep the operating cost very low while allowing sensitive magnetic measurements (better than 10-6 emu) and observation of coherent spin transport phenomena which are difficult to observe at elevated temperatures.

POR.DRECONTENT:
This grant is for the acquisition of a 9 Tesla Physical Properties Measurement System (PPMS) with Vibrating Sample Magnetometer (VSM) capabilities for use in interdisciplinary bulk and nanomaterials research and training.

More than 15 PhD students, 15 undergraduate students and 5 faculty members have been trained on the equipment. 

The measurements taken from the equipment have resulted in the following peer-reviewed achievable original research journal publications:

  1. 1.AylinYildiz, Derman Vatansever Bayramol, Rıza Atav, A. Ozgr Ağirgan, Mine Aydin Kur Uğur Ergnay, Carl Mayer, Ravi L.Hadimani, Synthesis and characterization of Fe3O4@Cs@Ag nanocomposite and its use in the production of magnetic and antibacterial nanofibrous membranes?, Appl. Surf. Sci., vol. 521, p. 146332, (2020)
  2. 2. Karam Nashwan Al-Milaji, Shalabh Gupta, Vitalij K. Pecharsky, Radhika Barua, Hong Zhao, Ravi L. Hadimani,  Differential effect of magnetic alignment on additive manufacturing of magnetocaloric particles, AIP Adv.., vol. 10, p. 015052, (2020)
  3. 3.Karam Nashwan Al-Milaji, Ravi L. Hadimani, Shalabh Gupta, Vitalij K. Pecharsky, Hong Zhao, Inkjet Printing of Magnetic Particles Toward Anisotropic Magnetic Properties, Nat. Sci. Rep., vol. 9, p. 16261, (2020)
  4. 4.Ajay Kumar Saw, Ganesha Channagoudra, Shivakumar Hunagund, R L Hadimani and Vijaylakshmi Dayal, Study of transport, magnetic and magnetocaloric properties in Sr2+ substituted praseodymium manganite Mater. Res. Exp., vol. 7, p. 016105, (2020)
  5. 5.Y. Shang, Y. Yuan, Y. Cao, R. L. Hadimani, Y. Mozharivskyj, and H. Fu, Structure, magnetic properties, and magnetocaloric effect of polycrystalline Ho3M (M = Rh, Ru) alloys, J. Magn. Magn. Mater., vol. 497, p. 166055, (2019)
  6. 6.J. H. Belo, A. L. Pires, I. T. Gomes, J. B. Sousa, J. P. Ara?jo, R. L. Hadimani, D.C.Jiles, Y.Ren, X. Zhang, A. M. Pereira, Giant Negative Thermal Expansion in nanogranular Gd5Si1.3Ge2.7 flexible-lattice framework Phys. Rev. B, vol. 100, pp. 134303, (2019)
  7. 7. J. H. Belo, A. L. Pires, I. T. Gomes, J. B. Sousa, R. L. Hadimani, D.C.Jiles, J. P. Araújo, A. M. Pereira, “Evolution of two-step magnetic transition on nanogranular Gd5Si1.3Ge2.7 thin film” J. Phys. D, vol. 32, no. 26, p. 265401, ( Feb. 2020)
  8. 8. C S Hunt, R Barua, E E Carpenter, “Influence of A-Site cation size-disorder on the magnetocaloric response of La0.6CaxSr0.4-xMnO3 nanoparticles” AIP Advances 10 (1), 015228

 The results have been disseminated at 64th MMM conference in Las Vegas, NV, November 2019 and 65th MMM conference at Miami Florida, USA in November 2020.  PI and collaborators also had submitted :

 

  1. Karam Al Milaji, S. Gupta, V. K. Pecharsky, Radhika Barua, H. Zhao, and R. L. Hadimani Differential Effect of Magnetic Alignment on Magnetocaloric Effect during Additive Manufacturing of Magnetocaloric Particles, MMM 2019 Las Vegas, NV, USA, Nov. 2019.
  2. V. Sharma, S. Gupta, A. Biswas, H. Fu, R. L. Hadimani, V.K. Pecharsky and R. Barua, “Finite-size effects on the magnetocaloric response of FeRh nanoparticles”, MMM 2019 Las Vegas, NV, USA, Nov. 2019.
  3. Dustin M. Clifford, Shalabh Guptab, Radhika Barua, Anis Biswas, Ravi Hadimani, Yaroslav Mudryk, and Vitalij K. Pecharsky, “Bulk-like First-order Phase Transition in Mechanochemically Fabricated FeRh Particles”, MMM 2020 Palm Beach, FL, USA, 4, Nov. 2020.
